intro: Gochnatia polymorpha subsp. ceanothifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gochnatia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy underneath. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
